title: Netlify-ready frontend ZIP export + deploy documentation

requirements.summary: Ensure the existing Netlify export workflow reliably generates `frontend/netlify-dist.zip` with required files at the ZIP root and fails with actionable errors when verification checks fail.
acceptanceCriteria: After running the export workflow, the file `frontend/netlify-dist.zip` exists in the repository workspace.
The ZIP contains the built site at the ZIP root (i.e., `index.html` is at the root of the ZIP, not nested under a `dist/` folder).
The ZIP includes the critical Netlify/SEO files: `index.html`, `googlecdab296682a0e0eb.html`, and `_redirects`.
If the export workflow fails (missing critical files or failing Google verification meta tag check), it exits with a non-zero code and prints an actionable error message.

file_operations.description: Harden the Netlify export workflow to strictly validate that `dist/index.html`, `dist/googlecdab296682a0e0eb.html`, and `dist/_redirects` exist and that the Google verification meta tag matches; ensure failure paths print actionable guidance (e.g., which source file to fix / what command to rerun) and exit non-zero.

Add (or, if it already exists in the project, update) a single, copy-pasteable npm script (e.g., `export:netlify`) that runs the existing workflow in `frontend/scripts/export-netlify-zip.mjs` from the `frontend` directory and produces `frontend/netlify-dist.zip`.

Generate and place the Netlify-ready export ZIP in the workspace at `frontend/netlify-dist.zip` by running the existing export workflow; confirm the ZIP root contains `index.html` and includes `googlecdab296682a0e0eb.html` and `_redirects`.

requirements.summary: Update `frontend/NETLIFY_DEPLOY.md` with a one-command export instruction (run from `frontend`) and concise manual Netlify upload steps for `frontend/netlify-dist.zip`.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/NETLIFY_DEPLOY.md` contains a complete, copy-pasteable command that generates `frontend/netlify-dist.zip` when run from the `frontend` directory.
`frontend/NETLIFY_DEPLOY.md` includes concise steps for Netlify manual deploy (Add new site → Deploy manually → upload `netlify-dist.zip`).

file_operations.description: Complete the guide by adding the exact one-command export instruction to be run from the `frontend` directory (calling the export workflow that creates `frontend/netlify-dist.zip`) and add concise manual Netlify deploy steps (Add new site → Deploy manually → upload `netlify-dist.zip`).
